call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - August 29th 2024

topics.title: Node 6.0 Alpha Release and Development Progress
topics.summary: kushti announced the first alpha release of Node 6.0 for local deployments and outlined the roadmap for upcoming releases. He also discussed ongoing work on sub-blocks implementation and Banxa deployment with three servers now running collateralized nodes.

topics.title: Sigmanauts Mining Pool Infrastructure Improvements
topics.summary: qx() discussed reducing mining pool server costs from $100 to $18 per month and successfully integrating storage rent collection code into Mining Core. The pool will be the first to officially run storage rent collection.

topics.title: Community Standards and Moderation Policies
topics.summary: qx() explained the need to establish written community standards for Sigmanauts chats to manage growing pains and ensure proper discourse. These standards will be enforced as the community grows larger.

topics.title: Russian Market Expansion Possibilities
topics.summary: kushti responded to questions about expanding in Russian markets given new crypto-friendly government announcements. He noted the crypto scene in Russia has been underground and expressed uncertainty about current legal developments and exchange listings.

topics.title: Developer Privacy and Legal Concerns
topics.summary: Discussion about anonymous developers like Morphic and concerns about legal risks for crypto developers. kushti explained the difference between running centralized services versus permissionless blockchains and varying jurisdictional approaches to developer liability.

topics.title: Dan Friedman Performance Defense
topics.summary: qx() defended Dan Friedman against community criticism, explaining his role as an EF advisor and his contributions through Palmyra and cross-chain technology development. He emphasized Dan's hard work and financial investment in projects that benefit Ergo.

topics.title: Tailstorm Protocol Analysis
topics.summary: kushti discussed his analysis of Tailstorm, noting similarities to existing proposals but highlighting that many features aren't applicable to Ergo due to its fixed emission schedule. He emphasized the need to finish Node 6.0 and sub-blocks implementation before pursuing new protocols.

topics.title: AI Impact on GPU Mining
topics.summary: kushti responded to concerns about AI corporations buying GPUs, stating that while some GPUs may still reach mining, the world increasingly needs GPUs for various computational tasks beyond just mining.

topics.title: Cardano Partnership Chain Possibilities
topics.summary: Discussion of potential Cardano partnership following Charles Hoskinson's tweets about partner chains. qx() suggested Ergo is already positioned as a partner through Rosen bridge, while kushti explored technical possibilities for trustless cross-chain relays using zero-knowledge proofs.

topics.title: ChainCash Use Cases and Implementation
topics.summary: kushti explained ChainCash use cases including community finance, trust-based currencies, and developer payments with collateralized notes. He discussed how notes can be split, redeemed partially, and backed by multiple reserves including real-world assets.
